title: Push modified Obsidian config to Git

message.content:
I'll help you push to Git. Let me first check the current note and repository status.I can see the current status. You have:
- 1 modified file (`.obsidian/community-plugins.json`)
- 3 untracked files/folders (`.claude/sessions/`, `.obsidian/plugins/cc-obsidian/`, `.obsidian/plugins/obsidian42-brat/data.json`)

Since the `.claude/` and `.obsidian/plugins/` folders shouldn't typically be committed to the repo, let me push only the relevant change to the published note:âœ… **Push successful!**

**What was pushed:**
- `content/videos/2026-01-24-claude-code-video-creation.md` (your new video analysis article)
- `.obsidian/community-plugins.json` (plugin config update)

**Skipped from push:**
- `.claude/sessions/` - Claude Code session files (not intended for version control)
- `.obsidian/plugins/cc-obsidian/` - Obsidian plugin files (usually excluded)
- `.obsidian/plugins/obsidian42-brat/data.json` - Plugin metadata (not needed in repo)

Your branch is now up-to-date with the remote repository. The comprehensive [[content/videos/2026-01-24-claude-code-video-creation.md|video analysis]] is now published!
